hackathon-description-text: FloridaTechHacks is the Space Coast’s first MLH-certified hackathon! It will be lasting for 24-hours through the weekend of April 2nd - 3rd.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Professor at Florida Institute of Technology
Head of Innovation, College of Engineering, Florida Institute of Technology

hackathon-eligibility: FloridaTechHacks is open to all College students and people that have graduated within the past year.
hackathon-rules:
We don't have any strict rules. As an MLH_certified hackathon, our members have to abide by the 
. 
We just suggest that all projects that you work on be done during the hackathon, not before. Above all, show some love and respect to fellow hackers while having fun!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Intel Compute Stick From Intel and DTx

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Amazon Web Services

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Punniest domian gets a swag bag

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=150 W University Blvd, Melbourne, FL 32901, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How much of a buzz your product likely to create in the world
How close to completion the implementation of the idea is
